Package miml.classifiers.miml.lazy

Class MIMLkNN

java.lang.Object
miml.classifiers.miml.MIMLClassifier
miml.classifiers.miml.lazy.MIMLkNN
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, IMIMLClassifier, IConfiguration, mulan.classifier.MultiLabelLearner
public class MIMLkNN
extends MIMLClassifier

Class implementing the MIMLkNN algorithm for MIML data. For more information, see Zhang, M. L. (2010, October). A k-nearest neighbor based multi-instance multi-label learning algorithm. In 2010 22nd IEEE International Conference on Tools with Artificial Intelligence (Vol.2, pp. 207-212). IEEE.

Version:
20180608
Author:
Alvaro A. Belmonte, Eva Gibaja, Amelia Zafra
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Method Details

    • buildInternal

      protected void buildInternal​(MIMLInstances trainingSet) throws java.lang.Exception
      Description copied from class: MIMLClassifier
      Learner specific implementation of building the model from MultiLabelInstances training data set. This method is called from MIMLClassifier.build(MultiLabelInstances) method, where behavior common across all learners is applied.
      Specified by:
      buildInternal in class MIMLClassifier
      Parameters:
      trainingSet - The training data set.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if learner model was not created successfully.
      See Also:
      MIMLClassifier.buildInternal(miml.data.MIMLInstances)

    • makePredictionInternal

      protected mulan.classifier.MultiLabelOutput makePredictionInternal​(MIMLBag instance) throws java.lang.Exception, mulan.classifier.InvalidDataException
      Description copied from class: MIMLClassifier
      Learner specific implementation for predicting on specified data based on trained model. This method is called from MIMLClassifier.makePrediction(weka.core.Instance) which guards for model initialization and apply common handling/behavior.
      Specified by:
      makePredictionInternal in class MIMLClassifier
      Parameters:
      instance - The data instance to predict on.
      Returns:
      The output of the learner for the given instance.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - If an error occurs while making the prediction.
      mulan.classifier.InvalidDataException - If specified instance data is invalid and can not be processed by the learner.

      protected boolean linearClassifier​(double[] weights, double[] record)
      Classifier that determines the labels associated with an example. A linear classifier uses the label counting vector of the example and the weight vector corresponding to the label,
      Parameters:
      weights - The weights correspondent to the label.
      record - The labels' record of bag's neighbor to be predicted.
      Returns:
      True, if belong to a determinate class, false if not.
